title: Text Title
body: Further down you will find guidance on ways to increase this customer frequency. Start exploring now, beginning with these statistics!

title: X1 Flip Card Title
body:
As we can see it’s easy to turn a Good-bye into a Great-bye! But why are we doing this? 


The key to this is frequency! Our customers love coming into a Pet Care Centre, and they can't help but spend when they do, but to help us continue to grow, we need this to happen more frequently. Our aim is to get every customer returning to a Pet Care Centre at least one extra time each year. 


There are three main benefits to doing this:

_incomplete.label: Select each card to learn more

_items.backText:
Build Customer Awareness


We offer so many amazing services and benefits that we know our customers aren’t aware of. By doing this it is ensuring we are making them aware of at least one further benefit of coming into a Pet Care Centre.

Increase Sales


When customers come into a Pet Care Centre, they can’t help but buy products or services from our amazing range. We need to encourage our customers to return more often so that this creates more of these sales.

Supporting Pets


Most of the additional services or benefits that will drive customers back into a Pet Care Centre will also give us more opportunities to help guide customers on the best ways to provide a happy and healthy life for their pets.

title: X2 Flip Card Title
body:

There are three main benefits to doing this:

_incomplete.label: Select each card to learn more

_items.backText:
Build Customer Awareness


We offer so many amazing services and benefits that we know our customers aren’t aware of. By doing this it is ensuring we are making them aware of at least one further benefit of coming into a Pet Care Centre.

Increase Sales


When customers come into a Pet Care Centre, they can’t help but buy products or services from our amazing range. We need to encourage our customers to return more often so that this creates more of these sales.

Supporting Pets


Most of the additional services or benefits that will drive customers back into a Pet Care Centre will also give us more opportunities to help guide customers on the best ways to provide a happy and healthy life for their pets.

_incomplete.label: Select each of the flashing icons

_items.title: Fact 1
_items.body: Own brand food customers shop two times more per year on average!

_items.title: Fact 2
_items.body: Wainwrights customers have the highest frequency and shop 18 times per year on average!

_items.title: Fact 3
_items.body:
There are 8.8 million Pets Club members. 

If they all visit just once more in a year it is worth £200 million!

title: Text Title
body:
Fact 1. Own brand food customers shop two times more per year on average!


Fact 2. Wainwrights customers have the highest frequency and shop 18 times per year on average!


Fact 3. There are 8.8 million Pets Club members. If they all visit just once more in a year it is worth £200 million!

title: Summary Action Button
body:
Remember Customer Magic involves every one of the 5 stages covered in the previous training:


  1. Welcoming the customer and then Approaching them as a separate action
  2. Having a customer first focus
  3. Having confidence in your recommendations
  4. Ensuring seamless handovers around the sore
  5. Providing magic moments that wow our customers


However we also want you to consider a sixth step: Making sure every customer gets a Great-bye that encourages them to return for one more visit.

Make sure you work with your manager to feel comfortable with how and when you can incorporate this in to your conversations with customers.

body:

Make sure you work with your manager to feel comfortable with how and when you can incorporate this in to your conversations with customers.

title: ACCESSIBLE INFOGRAPHIC
_source: <iframe loading="lazy" style="position: absolute; width: auto; height: 100%; top: 0; left: 0; border: none; padding: 0;margin: 0;"    src="https://www.canva.com/design/DAGU9e1JsEg/Z2hJf4V-AfImTLZAglZxvg/view?embed" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" allow="fullscreen"></iframe>

title: Text Title
body:
We hope you enjoyed uncovering some of the Great-byes for those customers. There are a series of infographics you can use to help you with other amazing ways to guide our customers back to us. 


Take a look at the options on show, and if you like them, you can ask your manager to make them visible in your Pet Care Centre.

_items.itemTitle: Select to Download
_items.body: If you're a manager completing this course, and want to download these infographics for use in your PCC, you can do this here:

_incomplete.label: Use the arrows on left and right of the graphics to scroll through all the conversation types.

_items.title: Great-byes - Tills & Services
_items.body: Use the arrows on left and right of the graphics to scroll through all the conversation types.

_items.title: Great-byes - Aquatics
_items.body: Use the arrows on left and right of the graphics to scroll through all the conversation types.

_items.title: Great-byes - Dog
_items.body: Use the arrows on left and right of the graphics to scroll through all the conversation types.

_items.title: Great-byes - Cat
_items.body: Use the arrows on left and right of the graphics to scroll through all the conversation types.

_items.title: Great byes - Other Pets
_items.body: Use the arrows on left and right of the graphics to scroll through all the conversation types.

_items.title: Great-byes for Tills & Services
_items.body:
The following are examples of Great-byes for tills and services scenarios


  1. Pets Club: “You’re all signed up for Pets Club! We’ve used XXX voucher, but don’t forget to come back and use your XXX voucher too. Also, the new Pets Club magazine is out next week, full of advice and savings! Just pop back in, and we’ll scan your card to get you your free copy!”
  2. Pets Birthday. “With your pet’s birthday coming up, don’t forget to come back and use your Pet’s Club birthday voucher! We’ve also got a fantastic range of birthday products in, from cakes, hats and bandanas for you to celebrate your pets special day!”
  3. Vets: "Your new puppy sounds adorable! If you’re not already registered with a vet, you could sign up with ours, where you have the great benefit of being able to bring your puppy in to meet our vet team before any appointments. This is great for their socialisation and ensures a positive experience for your puppy with vets"
  4. Easy Repeat: “Did you know you can save at least 5% on every bag of food you buy
    if you get it on an Easy Repeat order? I can help you get set up, and you can get it delivered to us here to pick up as you normally would on a schedule that suits you - so you never run out!”
  5. My PetPals: “I saw you and your child looking at all the different amazing pets that we have here! If you want to know more about our pets, you can book your child onto one of our free My PetPals workshops which run in the school holidays."
  6. Fulfilment: “I noticed you’ve got lots of pink accessories for your puppy, very cute! I overheard you were thinking of getting a crate? We actually have them in pink on our website! I can order one in for you with free collection here if you’d like!”

_items.title: Great-byes for Other Pets
_items.body:
The following are examples of Great-byes for 'other pet' work scenarios


  • Reptile Lighting. “It’s important to remember that UV bulbs have a lifespan of usually around 6-12 months. You can put a reminder in your phone and come back to see us for a replacement to help keep your reptiles happy and healthy.”
  • Small Animal Seasonal. “As the weather starts to turn, it might be an idea to think about bringing your rabbits indoors, or get a hutch cover to help keep them cosy. If you come back in with your hutch's measurements we can help you find one which will fit.” 
  • Rabbit Vaccine. “Vaccinating rabbits is really important, it’s better to do this after they have settled in with you. I can introduce you to our vets now and book the appointment, where you can use this voucher at a later date for their vaccinations and health checks.” 
  • Wildlife Workshop. “It sounds like they had a great time at the My Pet Pals workshop! If you want to pop back in the week when you have more time, we’d love to help you both pick out some bird feeders and food - perfect for encouraging wildlife visits at home!”
  • Wildlife. “I can see you’re a dedicated bird feeder! Since you mentioned the mess, a bird feeding table might be perfect for keeping things neat while still attracting the birds you love. I can order one for you, and you can pop back to collect when it’s ready!”

  • Reptile Food. “It can be beneficial to vary your reptiles diet and try different bugs! We can set up a special order for you, it will be here on (which ever day) for you to come and collect while they’re fresh.”

_items.title: Great-byes for Dog & Puppy
_items.body:
The following are examples of Great-byes for dog and puppy scenarios


  • Grooming: “As your puppy will need regular grooming as they grow due to their breed, it’s a good idea to socialise them to grooming early on. Lets pop over to the salon to meet the groomers, and get your puppy booked for their puppy groom to get started!”
  • Accessories. “As your puppy grows, it’s important to check that their collar fits comfortably and isn’t too tight. We’d recommend popping back in and we can check the fit. Plus, we also have collars that match the bed you’re buying, so you can keep them comfy and stylish!”
  • Parasites. “It’s really important to keep up with flea & worm treatments, especially as your puppy grows. Before starting a health plan, we need to make sure we have the right weight for your puppy. If you come back during the week, we can get them weighed and set up the right treatment plan for them.”
  • Seasonal. “As you’re working on training walks, especially with the weather changing, it’s a great time to think about a coat to keep your dog warm and dry. Why not pop back next week with your dog and we can help you find one that’s the perfect fit!”
  • Toys. “As your puppy gets older, their play style may change, and it’s great to have toys that match that. We’re always getting in new toy ranges, so feel free to pop back in for a chat so we can help find something that’s perfect for your puppy’s next stage of play!
  • Nutrition. “Every dog has its own activity level - so we need to make sure we have the right amounts of food for your dog. If you weigh your pet now, then come back in about 2 weeks, I can help you track their progress and make sure they’re getting the right amount to maintain a healthy BCS.”

_items.title: Great-byes for Cat & Kitten
_items.body:
The following are examples of Great-byes for cat and kitten scenarios


  • Parasites. “Since your cat’s an outdoor hunter, regular worming every month is key to keeping them healthy. Feel free to come back anytime, and we can help you pick up the right wormer for their needs.”
  • Toys. “As your cat grows, their play style can change too! They might love stalking or pouncing, but that could evolve over time. We have toys to match all sorts of play styles, and we’re always updating our range. Feel free to pop back and have a chat with me about keeping your cat's playtime exciting! “
  • Treats. “Did you know, we also have a new range of own brand cat treats that are designed to complement the food you’re already using. They have the same high quality ingredients, so a great match. Feel free to pop back in to check them out when they arrive!”
  • Seasonal. “This plug-in calming product you’re picking up today will last for 30 days, and we have the refills available here for you every time you need them. To make sure it’s effective as we approach firework season, it’s a good idea to pop back for a refill before then.”
  • Nutrition. “Our own brand products come with a money-back guarantee, so you can feel confident in giving it a try. If your cat likes it, this product also comes on promotion regularly, so feel free to pop back for a great deal!”
  • Kitten Vouchers. “Don’t forget as a Pets Club member, you’ve got a 50% off voucher for cat litter! Since it’s one of our own brand products, it also comes with a money-back guarantee, so you can try it out and see if it works for your kitten. If you like it, just come back and use your voucher to stock up!”

_items.title: Great-byes for Aquatics
_items.body:
The following are examples of Great-byes for aquatics scenarios


  • £5 fish Voucher. “Looks like you’ve got everything ready for your new tank! It just needs to run for 24 hours before adding any fish. When you’re ready, pop back in and we can help you choose your first fish. Remember to use your £5 off fish voucher on your Pets Club app!”
  • New Filter Media. “Now that you’ve got your new filter, don’t forget to replace the cartridges every few months. You could also add a Love Fish bio ball, which will help keep your water clear and help with filter maintenance. Let us know if you’d like one next time you’re here!”
  • Water Tests. “Your water test results look great! We’re more than happy to test it again anytime and offer advice to help keep it that way. Just pop back and we’ll advise on how you can ensure your water stays in top condition for your fish!”
  • New Tank. “Your new tank will be looking great! In about a week or so, you’ll need to start cleaning it. When you’re ready, come back for a siphon and we’ll happily show you how to use it to keep on top of your water changes!”
  • Fish Points. “You’ve got plenty of fish points left! Once these fish have settled and you’re ready, pop back in with a water test and we’d be happy to help you pick out your next exciting aquatic addition!”
  • Live Plants. “Great choice with the plants! Once they’ve settled in the tank, it might be worth popping back in to add a few more. We can also then help with plant food or fertiliser to keep them thriving!”

title: Dialog Title
body:
To assist you even further in increasing frequency of customer visits, it will help to try and encourage customer's to add the following products or categories to their basket, as we know these increase the likelihood of customer visits.


Take a look below and see what an incredible positive difference these products can make:

_incomplete.label: Select the button below the images to start and then progress through the 6 products/categories that boost frequency

dialogStartButtonText: Reveal how they help increase frequency:

_items.body:
Toys benefit both cats and dogs, and by having a range of types can help keep them mentally and physically stimulated, reduce stress, and prevent boredom.


Explain to customers that adding new toy types over time helps their pet. Our toy ranges are always evolving, so be sure to check Knowledge Kibbles to help match the right toy to the pet and drive repeat visits. Suggesting they frequently check for damaged toys and replace them, gives them a great reason to return.

Own Brand customers visit our Pet Care Centres 5 additional times per year on average. Our Own Brand offer consists of more than just nutrition, but you can use the same skills you use to transition customers to Own Brand foods across our other products. Customers loyal to our food brands may not be aware of our Own Brand accessories like beds, coats, and toys. Our seasonal accessories make perfect festive gifts. Let's inform our customers about our limited edition ranges.

40% of all cats and 50% of all dogs suffer from joint stiffness. If you see a customer buying mature pet food, talk to them about trying our joint care range. These usually come in a handy monthly supply, and are great for pets as well as increasing customer frequency.

Toppers can be a great way of adding variety to a diet, as well as keeping fussy eaters happy. Why not suggest a topper to complement their pet’s diet? Easy-Repeat ensures they never run out once they’ve found the perfect one!

Dental problems can be common for a variety of pets, and 85% of dogs develop a dental problem by the age of 3. Our dental ranges have something for all pet owners to help promote great oral hygiene for all life stages. Using our expertise to find the right product for their pet helps build loyalty and increase visits for these frequent purchase products.

Pets Grooming customers visit our Pet Care Centres 4.4 additional times, on average, per year. Try talking to customers about our range of pet sprays, which can help keep their pets smelling fresh between grooms. Even better, suggest introducing puppies that come to our PCC's to our salons, to build that bond and create opportunities for bookings.

title: Dialog Title
body:
To assist you even further in increasing frequency of customer visits, it will help to try and encourage customers to add the following products or categories to their basket, as we know these increase the likelihood of customer visits.


Take a look below and see what an incredible positive difference these products can make:

_incomplete.label: Select the button below the images to start and then progress through the 6 products/categories that boost frequency

dialogStartButtonText: Reveal how they help increase frequency:

_items.body:
Toys benefit both cats and dogs, and by having a range of types can help keep them mentally and physically stimulated, reduce stress, and prevent boredom.


Explain to customers that adding new toy types over time helps their pet. By suggesting they frequently check for damaged toys and replace them, this gives them a great reason to return.

Our Own Brand offer consists of more than just nutrition, but you can use the same skills you use to transition customers to Own Brand foods across our other products. Customers loyal to our food brands may not be aware of our Own Brand accessories like beds, coats, and toys. Our seasonal accessories make perfect festive gifts. Let's inform our customers about our limited edition ranges.

Toppers can be a great way of adding variety to a diet, as well as keeping fussy eaters happy. Why not suggest a topper to complement their pet’s diet? Easy-Repeat ensures they never run out once they’ve found the perfect one!

Dental problems can be common for a variety of pets, and 85% of dogs develop a dental problem by the age of 3. Our dental ranges have something for all pet owners to help promote great oral hygiene for all life stages. Using our expertise to find the right product for their pet helps build loyalty and increase visits for these frequent purchase products.

Even better, suggest introducing puppies that come to our PCC's to our salons, to build that bond and create opportunities for bookings.

_incomplete.label: Select the '+' icons to expand each question

_items.title: Round 1 - Question 1
_items.body:
You notice a customer walking up and down the puppy food aisle whilst you're cleaning out the pet adoption bay. What do you do?


  • Nothing, they’ll ask for help if they need it and there's a lot of clean up to do.
  • See if they are still there when you head to the warehouse for some more supplies and approach them then.
  • Approach the customer and say, "I noticed you’ve been looking at the puppy food, do you need any support in choosing which food to buy?".

Feedback

Provided that attending to the customer does not affect the wellbeing of our pets, you should proactively assist the customer if they require support.

_items.title: Round 1 - Question 2
_items.body:
A customer is looking at some bird seed, they have 2 different types in their hand. You're facing up the shelves in the next aisle. What do you do?


  • Move to their aisle to start facing up there, so they can approach you if they need to.
  • Ignore them and carry on with the task at hand.
  • Approach the customer saying, "I see you’ve been looking at bird seed, what type of birds are you buying seed for?"

Feedback

You should proactively approach and offer support to the customer.

_items.title: Round 1 - Question 3
_items.body:
You've been tasked with picking a Click & Collect order that has just come through before your break. Whilst doing so you see a customer looking at some fish. You’ve noticed that they’ve been staring at the same tank for quite a while now, what do you do?


  • Complete the Click & Collect work. Its essential for the flow of the store to keep on-track with your tasks.
  • Approach the customer and say ‘Hi, welcome to Pets at Home’ then walk away but stay close by.
  • Say "I find fish very therapeutic to watch, what is your current aquatics setup like at home?".

Feedback

Initiate contact with the customer and open up a conversation.

_items.title: Round 1 - Question 4
_items.body:
You're in the midst of replenishing the feature space and overhear a customer chatting to their child near the small animal area. 


"Yes, we could buy 2 of those Syrian hamsters, so they have company for each other". 


What would you do?


  • Carry on with the replenishment as it's core to sales.
  • Get on your headset and call a colleague over to talk to them.
  • Approach the customer and their child and say "I couldn't help overhearing you were thinking of buying two of our Syrian hamsters, you would need to keep them apart as they are solitary animals. If you wanted to keep two together, then our Roborovski dwarf hamsters may be more suitable with the right cage and enrichments."

Feedback

Approach the customer to provide guidance to ensure that they make an informed decision and do not purchase pets that may lead to harm.

_items.title: Round 1 - Question 5
_items.body:
You're on the Tills (which are right in front of the store entrance) but haven't got a customer with you. You notice a customer put some flea treatment back on the shelf and begin to walk to the exit. What would you do?


  • Stay attentive to possible customers wanting to pay, you don't want to miss a sale.
  • Get on your headset and call a colleague to see if someone can catch them.
  • Speak to the customer from behind the desk and ask ‘I noticed you looking at flea treatments, did you find everything you were looking for today or did you need any help?’

Feedback

While stationed at the till in case of customer assistance, approach the customer to check if they have found everything they needed, or if they require any support.

_items.title: Round 2 - Question 1
_items.body:
You approach a customer you've overheard talking to their child about buying a guinea pig for their birthday. Which of these would be a good approach question?


  • Hi, I overheard you talking. Are you just after one?
  • Hi, I overheard you talking. Would your child like a girl or a boy guinea pig?
  • Hi, I overheard you talking. Have you thought of any names yet? What do you think they should be called? (gesturing towards the guinea pig they are looking at).

Feedback

Use open-ended questions to obtain additional details that will aid you in providing tailored assistance to the customer.

_items.title: Round 2 - Question 2
_items.body:
You approach a customer in the aquatic section. They have a couple of different filter products in their hands. What would you ask the customer?


  • Is the filter for coldwater or tropical fish?
  • Can you explain your aquarium setup, I can then guide you on the best products?
  • Which one would you like?

Feedback

Use open-ended questions to obtain specific details that will help you guide the customer to the best products for their particular aquarium set up.

_items.title: Round 2 - Question 3
_items.body:
You've approached a customer looking at the kitten accessories, and they've mentioned that it's their first pet. What would you say?


  • Oh that's great, there's lot's to choose from, I'll let you have a look around.
  • Oh how lovely. You're in the right area of the store, I'll let you pick out some nice things.
  • Oh how lovely, do you have a name yet? What is it you're looking for? We may even have one our our Own Brand versions to save you money.

Feedback

Engage the customer in conversation by asking open-ended questions about their new kitten and their needs. Mention the possibility of saving money by recommending suitable products from our own brand.

_items.title: Round 2 - Question 4
_items.body:
There's a customer carrying a puppy bed and talking to their partner "This is just not big enough for them; Where are the rest of the beds?" Which of these is the best question to open your approach with?


  • Are you looking for a larger bed?
  • Can I help you find a bigger bed for your puppy?
  • I see you're looking for a larger bed for your puppy, can you tell me a bit more about your puppy's size? I'd be happy to take you to our full selection of beds to help you find the perfect one. In fact we have some great promotions on beds this week.

Feedback

Enquire about the size of the customer's puppy for more precise information. Present the current array of beds and guide them towards the options that are currently on promotion.

_items.title: Round 2 - Question 5
_items.body:
You're replenishing the dog food when you see a customer reading the back of packets. Which of these is the best question to approach with?


  • Don't approach them. Take time to clear the stock away safely then approach the customer. if they're still there.
  • Excuse me, do you need any help?
  • Excuse me, how can I help you? We actually sell an Own Brand product just like that, which will save you some money.

Feedback

Initiate a conversation with the customer and propose recommendations on how they can save money by switching to our own brand of dog food.

title: Game Title
body: Creating the opportunity for Customer Magic to happen is key to the success of Pets at Home, Pets Grooming, and Vets for Pets. This game tests your decisions in making those opportunities occur.
instruction: Warning: This game has music and sound effects. If you find these distracting, either mute your device or right click the web browser tab and select 'Mute Site/Tab' - Have fun
gameStartBody:
Welcome to the Customer Magic game!


You will be playing against two other players. Try your best to beat them.


The game is made up of 2 rounds, with 5 questions in each round.


If you get on an answer streak you can pick up bonus points.


If you need help look in the bottom left corner for the 'Hint' power-up.
characterSelectBody: Select the character you wish to play as.
dropInstructionText: Drop the card in the correct zone
orderingInstructionText: Select the cards in the correct order
averageTimeStatText: Seconds you spent on average per question
streakInstructionText: Get 3 correct answers in a row for bonus points

first.feedbackBody: Well done - you're becoming an Approach champion!

second.feedbackBody: Give the game another go to see if you can win!

third.feedbackBody: Give the game another go to see if you can win!

_rounds.roundBody: In this Round all questions will be based on the situations you find yourself in whilst around the store, and which decision is the right one to take.
_rounds.roundEndBody:
Are you ready for Round 2? 


See if you can finish as the top player.

_questions.questionText: You notice a customer walking up and down the puppy food aisle whilst you're cleaning out the pet adoption bay. What do you do?

_answers.answerText: Nothing, theyll ask for help if they need it and there's a lot of clean up to do.
See if they are still there when you head to the warehouse for some more supplies and approach them then.
Approach the customer and say, "I noticed youve been looking at the puppy food, do you need any support in choosing which food to buy?".

_questions.questionText: A customer is looking at some bird seed, they have 2 different types in their hand. You're facing up the shelves in the next aisle. What do you do?

_answers.answerText: Move to their aisle to start facing up there, so they can approach you if they need to.
Ignore them and carry on with the task at hand.
Approach the customer saying, "I see youve been looking at bird seed, what type of birds are you buying seed for?"

_questions.questionText: You've been tasked with picking a Click & Collect order that has just come through before your break. Whilst doing so you see a customer looking at some fish. You’ve noticed that they’ve been staring at the same tank for quite a while now, what do you do?

_answers.answerText: Complete the Click & Collect work. Its essential for the flow of the store to keep on-track with your tasks.
Approach the customer and say Hi, welcome to Pets at Home then walk away but stay close by.
Say "I find fish very therapeutic to watch, what is your current aquatics setup like at home?".

_questions.questionText:
You're in the midst of replenishing the feature space and overhear a customer chatting to their child near the small animal area. 


"Yes, we could buy 2 of those Syrian hamsters, so they have company for each other". 


What would you do?

_answers.answerText: Carry on with the replenishment as it's core to sales.
Get on your headset and call a colleague over to talk to them.

Approach the customer and their child and say "I couldn't help overhearing you were thinking of buying two of our Syrian hamsters, you would need to keep them apart as they are solitary animals. If you wanted to keep two together, then our Roborovski dwarf hamsters may be more suitable with the right cage and enrichments."

_questions.questionText: You're on the Tills (which are right in front of the store entrance) but haven't got a customer with you. You notice a customer put some flea treatment back on the shelf and begin to walk to the exit. What would you do?

_answers.answerText: Stay attentive to possible customers wanting to pay, you don't want to miss a sale.
Get on your headset and call a colleague to see if someone can catch them.
Speak to the customer from behind the desk and ask I noticed you looking at flea treatments, did you find everything you were looking for today or did you need any help?

_rounds.roundBody: This Round is based on the questions you can ask a customer when you approach them. Pick the better question to win.
_rounds.roundEndBody:
Well done - That's Round 2, and the Game is complete.


Find out how you did.

_questions.questionText: You approach a customer you've overheard talking to their child about buying a guinea pig for their birthday. Which of these would be a good approach question?

_answers.answerText: Hi, I overheard you talking. Are you just after one?
Hi, I overheard you talking. Would your child like a girl or a boy guinea pig?
Hi, I overheard you talking. Have you thought of any names yet? What do you think they should be called? (gesturing towards the guinea pig they are looking at).

_questions.questionText: You approach a customer in the aquatic section. They have a couple of different filter products in their hands. What would you ask the customer?

_answers.answerText: Is the filter for coldwater or tropical fish?
Can you explain your aquarium setup, I can then guide you on the best products?
Which one would you like?

_questions.questionText: You've approached a customer looking at the kitten accessories, and they've mentioned that it's their first pet. What would you say?

_answers.answerText: Oh that's great, there's lot's to choose from, I'll let you have a look around.
Oh how lovely. You're in the right area of the store, I'll let you pick out some nice things.
Oh how lovely, do you have a name yet? What is it you're looking for? We may even have one our our Own Brand versions to save you money.

_questions.questionText: There's a customer carrying a puppy bed and talking to their partner "This is just not big enough for them; Where are the rest of the beds?" Which of these is the best question to open your approach with?

_answers.answerText: Are you looking for a larger bed?
Can I help you find a bigger bed for your puppy?

I see you're looking for a larger bed for your puppy, can you tell me a bit more about your puppy's size? I'd be happy to take you to our full selection of beds to help you find the perfect one. In fact we have some great promotions on beds this week.

_questions.questionText: You're replenishing the dog food when you see a customer reading the back of packets. Which of these is the best question to approach with?

_answers.answerText: Don't approach them. Take time to clear the stock away safely then approach the customer. if they're still there.
Excuse me, do you need any help?
Excuse me, how can I help you? We actually sell an Own Brand product just like that, which will save you some money.

title: See Game Question Feedback
body: If you got any questions wrong in the game and wish to see the best available answers, use this button to reveal the game feedback. This is optional.
buttonAriaLabel: See Game Question Feedback - Select here

title: iFrame Title
body:
We think the Great-bye ideas we’ve given you above are … well, great! But we believe in the power of our colleague community to do even better. So we want you to submit your Great-bye ideas that we will share with your colleagues. 


Only complete this form if you're submitting a proper idea. This is not mandatory for completion of this course.
instruction: Please note that you will need to sign in with your Pets at Home Microsoft Account to submit your ideas. If you are unable to do this, please send your submission to training@petsathome.co.uk with the title 'Great-bye Suggestion'.
_source: <iframe width="640px" height="480px" src="https://forms.cloud.microsoft/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=DQSIkWdsW0yxEjajBLZtrQAAAAAAAAAAAAO__bP7g_pUQlJISFBXVk1VUzg4OUpYTTA1ODRBMERCNS4u&embed=true" frameborder="0" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" style="border: none; max-width:100%; max-height:100vh" allowfullscreen webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen msallowfullscreen> </iframe>

title: X1 Great-Bye Branching Title
body:
Get started and choose at least one route through the adventure. Remember, the more routes you take, the more ideas you generate!  Please note that there are videos containing sound. If you wish to turn off the sound or adjust the volume, this can be done by hovering over the video and interacting with the speaker icon.


Please note that all scenarios shown are for illustrative purposes only and do not represent the current pricing, products or propositions in use in the Pets at Home Pet Care Centres at present.

_incomplete.label: Select the button to open the adventure. Complete at least one route all the way to a Great-bye ending.

_items.body:
As winter trading gets going, customers flood into the stores. Going left, going right and going straight forward. As they fly through the door you and your colleagues greet them with joy.


Which customer will you choose to approach?

_options.optionText: Head left
Head right
Head straight

_items.body: The customer has stopped to look at the rabbits. You approach them to see if they need any help and the customer says they are interested in...

_options.optionText: Getting some fresh bedding for their rabbit, but just stopped to look at the ones here first.
Nothing, they simply walked into look at the rabbits.
Getting another rabbit for the family.

_items.body: You see a customer over in the kitten section. But what are they looking at?

_options.optionText: Kitten treats
Kitten food
Kitten toys

_items.body:
You keep an eye on the customer as they walk over to the dog nutrition aisle, and they start pacing up and down.


You approach them. What does the customer say they need help with?

_options.optionText: They are looking for a new food to save some money
Their usual food seems to be out of stock so they are looking for something different
They are looking for puppy food as they've just picked up their first family pet

_items.body:
After a detailed conversation you understand that they are on Iams at present and they agree to give the new Nutribalance Own Brand a try.


You also realise that the customer isn't signed up to Pets Club, so you get them signed up so they can save 10% on their first shop. The customer is delighted.


Now what?

_options.optionText: Guide them to the till, carrying the food for them, before wishing them a happy rest of their day.
Discuss transitioning of the food and then give them a reason to return.

_items.body:
What you just did was deliver a Good-bye. That customer will be happy with the service they've received, and will likely give a great survey response. 


But how could we do better?  Rewind to find out.

_options.optionText: REWIND!

_items.body: There are a number of ways we can provide a Great-bye here. Pick the one you want to use...

_options.optionText: Advise the customer that when transitioning foods it can often be complicated to ensure their pet doesn't receive too much or too little. Explain that if they weigh their pet now, and then come back two weeks later, you can help to track whether they are feeding the right amount to provide a healthy Body Condition Score.
Suggest the customer comes back in two weeks for a follow up chat about how their dog has taken to the food and what adjustments could be made.

Suggest setting up an easy-repeat order for the food. And even better, suggest they order it to the PCC, then it prompts them to have a regular check up for at least the first month or two of trying out the new diet.

_items.body:
Well done - you provided a Great-bye.


A few days / weeks after you chat with the customer they came back into the store and whilst there also purchased a small toy and some treats. Even better, it gave the colleague that day the opportunity to recommend booking in a Groom, and they will be back again soon!

_options.optionText: Get in touch to see how I can add value to your learning solutions.

_items.body:
After speaking to the customer you understand that they have a few days worth of their dog's food left. You search and find their food on order. 


The customer runs through the order and arranges for it to be delivered to them at home. 


They are really happy that they were able to get sorted with your help.


Now what?

_options.optionText: You thank the customer and advise them that they can set up an easy-repeat order for future, but they decline. Either way, they are very happy and are aware of the service. They leave, pleased with their service as you say goodbye.
As you finish off the order, you start to pay attention to the other items in the customer's basket, as these indicate their pets needs and may give a great reason for the customer to come back

_items.body:
You notice that the bedding they want isn't on the shelves, but after a quick check of the delivery that just came in, you find exactly what they want.


Whilst there you get the rabbit out for their child to stroke.


Their child is overwhelmed at the cuteness and the customer is really pleased. What next?

_options.optionText: The customer puts the bedding into their trolley and says thank you. You wish them a great day and say goodbye, as they head to the till.
Keep talking to the customer, looking for a reason that will help them and bring them back.

_items.body:
You chat to the customer and ask if they already have a rabbit, and their child tells you they have a Syrian hamster.


You offer to get the rabbit out for the child to stroke, as you talk to the customer about hamster housing options. After putting the rabbit back, you guide the customer to the small animal housing and they pick up a Playsticks for their hamster. 


What happens next?

_options.optionText: You high five the child who is still buzzing with excitement, and then wish the customer goodbye as they head to the till.
Seeing that the child is so excited by the rabbit you ask the parent whether they are considering adding one to their family, as this may lead to a reason to return.

_items.body:
You discuss as much as you can learn about their current rabbit, including its housing situation, temperament and what caused them to start looking for a new rabbit.


You introduce them to the adoption rabbits that you have. The customer loves this, as they like the idea of giving them a second chance. And even better you explain that they get free neutering and free vaccination voucher. They are thrilled.


What next?

_options.optionText: You work through the Pets Foundation adoption, but as you do, you start signposting other services we offer to the customer, which peaks their interest.
You work through the Pets Foundation adoption process on the ACE device with the customer and then say goodbye as they leave with their new pet.

_items.body:
That's amazing. You provided a Great-bye that brought the customer back in.


When they came in, they couldn't help but get hooked by the kitten toy range, buying a variety of toys to find out their playing preference.

_options.optionText: Get in touch to see how I can add value to your learning solutions.

_items.body:
Well done - you provided a Great-bye.


A few days / weeks after you chat with the customer they came back into the store and whilst there also purchased a new hutch!

_options.optionText: Get in touch to see how I can add value to your learning solutions.

_items.body:
You have a great conversation with the customer and learn a lot about their puppy (who isn't with them), setting them up with a recommendation for AVA Breed Specific Cockapoo.


You also register them for Pets Club and advise they use one of their vouchers.


But what next?

_options.optionText: Pick up the food for them and take it to the till, seamlessly handing over the customer to your colleague on the till so they know to process the Pets Club voucher.
Continue the conversation and ask more about their puppy to understand the needs they have, carrying their food in the direction of the till.

_items.body:
The customer is by the treat section, browsing options and wondering what treats they can safely give their kitten. You approach them, and after a conversation, establish more about the kitten's current diet to ensure the kitten is settled with their food to avoid any potential digestive issues when introducing new treats. 


You discuss the role of kitten treats, including supporting bonding, training, and enrichment. 


You then ask if they would like any further advice, or if they’re set with their selection for now. What comes next?

_options.optionText: You share a couple of ideas for getting the most out of their treat choices, offering additional options for how treats can help with play, training, and bonding, and wish them well for the rest of their day.

You thank the customer, and say you hope the kitten enjoys their new treats. You remind them theyre welcome to come back anytime if they have more questions about treats or nutrition. Before saying good bye you add one extra bit of help/advice.

_items.body:
You approach the customer in the kitten toy aisle and engage them in conversation, to find out they're looking for toys to keep their kitten active. You explain all about play styles of kittens and the benefits of play. Signing them up to Pets Club, you offer a complimentary kitten companion book, packed with advice and recommendations, which the customer happily accepts.


You ask if they would like some guidance on selecting the best toys for their kitten or if they’re all set for now. What’s next?

_options.optionText: You smile, thank the customer, and wish them luck with their new toys, letting them know youre available anytime they need further guidance, as you wave goodbye.
You mention that youre here to help them find the right match and discuss options they may want to try as their kitten grows and develops preferences. The conversation continues.

_items.body:
You approach the customer. They mention that their kitten came from the breeder on a specific brand, but they’re interested in switching to a more affordable option, possibly our own brand. After a brief conversation, you understand their preferences and their kittens needs and explain that transitioning is common, reassuring them that our own brand offers quality nutrition and present some suitable options.


You mention the vouchers available as part of Pets Club as a new kitten owner and advise them on transitioning.


What would you do next?

_options.optionText: You reassure the customer that transitioning is a positive step and that youre available to help if they encounter any issues. You mention the money-back guarantee on own brand, encouraging them to feel confident in their choice and to reach out if they need further assistance, and wish the customer well.

You continue the conversation with the customer, further discussing transitioning, and mentioning the money back guarantee on own brand, to lock in that sale, but continue to explore their needs to find a way to encourage them back.

_items.body:
There are a few ways we can create a Great-bye, but it may mean continuing the conversation a little further with the customer to learn more about their pet and their needs.


You chat with them a little more as you start to head towards the till and learn that...

_options.optionText: As you've uncovered that their puppy is a cockapoo, who is already getting matted hair, you talk to the customer about the importance of grooming socialisation and take them over to the Pets Grooming salon where they book to return for a Puppy Groom.

You talk to the customer about them training their dog to walk, and mention the change in the weather. This leads to a conversation about dog coats. You recommend the customer comes back next week with their puppy to get fitted for a coat to keep them warm and dry.

You discover that they aren't on any flea or worming treatments and speak to the customer about the importance of this. You explain how vital it is to know the correct weight for a puppy before signing them up, so advise the customer returns next week to get their puppy weighed and a subscription started.

_items.body:
Well done - you provided a Great-bye.


A few days / weeks after you chat with the customer they came back into the store and whilst there, they also purchased some shampoo for their pup. Even better, they also booked their child onto a My Pets Pal session they saw advertised that week.

_options.optionText: Get in touch to see how I can add value to your learning solutions.

_items.body:
What you just did was deliver a Good-bye. That customer will be happy with the service they've received, and will likely give a great survey response. 


But how could we do better?  Rewind to find out.

_options.optionText: REWIND

_items.body: You notice that the have already picked up...

_options.optionText: ...nothing! So you advise the customer about the promotional offers that are due to start next week - and that they are only due to last for two weeks. The customer is interested in some of the promotions so you suggest they come back to take advantage, as before stock runs out.

...a seasonal (Halloween) toy. You mention that the new Christmas range is due to be put out in the next few days, and the doggy advent calendars usually fly off the shelves. The customer's interest peaks and you recommend that they come back on delivery days so they don't miss out.

...some anti-shedding shampoo. You start to discuss the benefits of professional grooming, which leads to you walking the customer to the Pets Grooming Salon where they book in a groom for a week later.

_items.body:
You finish off by wishing the customer goodbye and helping them to the till. Well done - you provided a Great-bye.


A few days / weeks after you chat with the customer they came back into the store and took advantage of some of the Promotions on that week.

_options.optionText: Get in touch to see how I can add value to your learning solutions.

_items.body:
What you just did was deliver a Good-bye. That customer will be happy with the service they've received, and will likely give a great survey response. 


But how could we do better?  Rewind to find out.

_options.optionText: REWIND!

_items.body:
What you just did was deliver a Good-bye. That customer will be happy with the service they've received, and will likely give a great survey response. 


But how could we do better?  Rewind to find out.

_options.optionText: REWIND!

_items.body:
With the customer having saved money on the neutering, they are open to hearing about other services.


Which service do they seem interested in?

_options.optionText: Complete Care Health Plans from the Vets - You give them a brief overview of the benefits of having a health plan as you walk them over to the Vets reception.  They book in for an initial consult later that week.

Easy repeat: The words the customer uses leads you to understand they frequently purchase their food and bedding from us. Explain the benefits of doing this via an Easy-Repeat order, ideally ordered to the Pet Care Centre, ensuring multiple return visits.

Registering their new pet for Pets Club on their App - You do this and advise them that they will likely receive offers for their new rabbit in the next few hours/days via the App. You suggest that they come back in to make the most of them as it will help with the cost of setting up a new rabbit. The customer is pleased with this idea, and heads to the till with their new pet, and scans their Pets Club Card.

_items.body:
What you just did was deliver a Good-bye. That customer will be happy with the service they've received, and will likely give a great survey response. 


But how could we do better?  Rewind to find out.

_options.optionText: REWIND!

_items.body:
The customer distracts their child with YouTube on their phone as they continue the conversation with you and advise that they have been considering this for a while, but are pressed for time.


How do you turn this into a Great-bye?

_options.optionText: Tell them when you are on shift over the next couple of weeks and agree a time for them to return to have a discussion about it when their child isn't around. You then wish them a happy rest of their day, and say goodbye.

You make a suggestion that they might want to consider bringing their child along to a feeding time so that they can have a bit more interaction with a rabbit before they make a final decision. The customer loves this idea and writes down the feeding times on their phone, before you part ways and say goodbye.

_items.body:
Well done - you provided a Great-bye.


When the customer returns they pick up a packet of small animal treats for their hamster to nibble on, and even better, they agree to come back again, with their child to pick out their rabbits.

_options.optionText: Get in touch to see how I can add value to your learning solutions.

_items.body:
What you just did was deliver a Good-bye. That customer will be happy with the service they've received, and will likely give a great survey response. 


But how could we do better?  Rewind to find out.

_options.optionText: REWIIND!

_items.body:
You keep talking and advise them when your store receives deliveries, until you uncover a great reason to bring them back.


What reason do you give?

_options.optionText: The customer is preparing to bring their rabbit inside for winter, but they want to ensure they always have bedding available. You suggest that they set up an easy-repeat order for their hay and wood-shavings to get delivered to the store, as they mentioned that they find it difficult to get deliveries as they are rarely home during the day.

The customer mentions that their rabbit sometimes struggles with moving back indoors over winter. You introduce them to Pet Remedy and suggest that the customer could either take it now, or wait to see how their rabbit adjusts this year, and come back to get some if they become anxious.

The customer is preparing to bring their rabbit inside for winter, and you suggest an easy-repeat order, but they don't wish to set up a continuous payment. You guide them to open their Pets App and show them how to do a Click & Collect to ensure the stock is available for them when they need it next time.

_items.body:
Well done - you provided a Great-bye.


The customer comes back in a few weeks later which leads to them also having a conversation about a separate enclosure for their rabbit to use when indoors. This ends up being a great additional sale made!

_options.optionText: Get in touch to see how I can add value to your learning solutions.

_items.body:
What you just did was deliver a Good-bye. That customer will be happy with the service they've received, and will likely give a great survey response. 


But how could we do better?  Rewind to find out.

_options.optionText: REWIND!

_items.body: You continue the conversation with the customer, finding a reason to encourage their return. What was the idea?

_options.optionText: The customer is interested in different treats for their kitten, so you explain its best to wait until the food transition is complete before introducing any new treats to avoid digestive issues. You suggest they come back once their kitten is settled on the new food so you can discuss suitable treat options for their kitten and let them know when youre on shift next.

The customer wants to maximise their Pets Club vouchers, so you let them know they can use their joining voucher on supplier food today. If they find their kitten adjusts well to our own brand, they can use one of their vouchers on their next visit, encouraging them to return.

The customer is concerned about potential issues when transitioning their kitten's food, so you reassure them that gradual changes are typically effective and that you're available to help if needed. You also mention that if they are not currently registered with a vet on a plan, our in-store vets offer a kitten-specific care plan. You walk them over to the vets and they sign up to Complete Care Junior. They then book the customer in for their discounted nose-to-tail health check offer with our vets, so the customer will return.

_items.body:
What you just did was deliver a Good-bye. That customer will be happy with the service they've received, and will likely give a great survey response. 


But how could we do better?  Rewind to find out.

_options.optionText: REWIND!

_items.body: As the conversation continues you spot a fantastic opportunity to create a great-bye. What was it?

_options.optionText: The customer asks about additional toys, so you explain how kittens play evolves as they grow. You mention that understanding their kittens play style, like stalking or pouncing, can help match them with the right toys over time. You add that new themed toy ranges will be arriving soon, so theyre welcome to come back and explore options as their kittens interests develop.

The customer is curious about using catnip toys. You explain that while some kittens may not respond to catnip until theyre a bit older, it can be a great way to encourage interaction with toys later on. You invite them to check back in a few months to explore catnip sprays and toys as their kitten develops, making it easy to keep playtime exciting and tailored to their kittens growth.

The customer expresses concern about scratching. You reassure them that scratching is normal, explaining that the cardboard hide-and-seek scratcher we have is a good starting point. However, as their kitten grows, its preferences and scratching needs might change. You suggest monitoring its behaviour and remind them to pop back in to explore options for larger or different styles of scratchers that better suit their kittens growing needs, that youd be more than happy to guide them through.

_items.body:
Well done - You provided a great-bye for the customer.


When they returned to the store they also spoke to the vets and signed up to Complete Care Junior!

_options.optionText: Get in touch to see how I can add value to your learning solutions.

_items.body:
What you just did was deliver a Good-bye. That customer will be happy with the service they've received, and will likely give a great survey response. 


But how could we do better?  Rewind to find out.

_options.optionText: REWIND!

_items.body: What is that advice?

_options.optionText: You mention that a new range of own-brand kitten treats, specifically designed to complement their current food, will be arriving soon. You invite the customer to come back to check out these new treats, letting them know that theyre designed with the same high-quality ingredients as the kitten food theyre already using.

You point out that the selected treat is currently on promotion and suggest that if the kitten enjoys it, it might be worth returning before the offer ends to stock up. The customer appreciates the heads-up and likes the idea of getting a few extras if their kitten loves the treats.

You introduce treat-dispensing puzzle toys, explaining how they help with mental stimulation and enrichment, which is great for kittens. You show them the selection available, letting them know that any item can be ordered for free delivery to the store within the week. Theyre excited by the option and agree to place an order, planning to come back and pick it up when it arrives.

_items.body: You have just given the customer another reason to enjoy coming into our the Pet Care Centres. Well done for making a good-bye into a great-bye.

_options.optionText: Get in touch to see how I can add value to your learning solutions.

_items.body: Branching item text

_options.optionText: Option text

_items.body: Branching item text

_options.optionText: Option text

_items.body: Branching item text

_options.optionText: Option text

_items.body: Branching item text

_options.optionText: Option text

_items.body: Branching item text

_options.optionText: Option text

_items.body: Branching item text

_options.optionText: Option text

_items.body: Branching item text

_options.optionText: Option text

_items.body: Branching item text

_options.optionText: Option text

_items.body: Branching item text

_options.optionText: Option text

_items.body:
Did you like this experience?


Get in touch to discuss how we could work together to elevate the impact of your learning solutions.


This branching scenario creates an interactive and engaging story that allows colleagues to tailor the experience for their needs whilst allowing them to learn how they can improve.


Reach out on grahamjbetts@gmail.com and let's kick start performance for your business.

title: Graphic Title
body:
But how do you drive frequency? 


The simple answer is that it takes a little bit of extra thought in your conversation, working out the most effective way to encourage a customer back to us. In the spirit of Customer Magic, we want to have a bit of fun as we learn about Great-byes and the opportunities we have. 


Below is an activity that will help you uncover excellent examples of how to encourage a customer back into a Pet Care Centre.

_graphic.alt: Choose your customer's adventure Game title

title: X2 Link Title
body:
In the spirit of Customer Magic, we want to have a bit of fun as we learn about Great-byes and the opportunities we have. 


Below is an activity that will help you uncover excellent examples of how to encourage a customer back into the Pet Care Centre. 


Select the button below to download a document version of the interactive 'choose your customer's adventure' activity. Get started and choose at least one route through the adventure. Remember, the more routes you take, the more ideas you generate!

title: X1 HIDE Image Slider Title
displayTitle: How important are our products and services to increasing frequency?
body: Below are a series of statistics that show quite how valuable it can be to include Pets own brands and services in your Great-byes!

_incomplete.label: Drag the slider across to reveal how many more times a customer will visit each year if they engage with the following products or services. Note, this instruction will not change on completion of this slider activity.

_complete.label: Drag the slider across to reveal how many more times a customer will visit each year if they engage with the following products or services. Note, this instruction will not change on completion of this slider activity.

handleAriaLabel: Use the cursor keys to move the image slider

title: Text Title
displayTitle: How important are our products and services to increasing frequency?
body:
Below are a series of statistics that show quite how valuable it can be to include Pets own brands and services in your Great-byes!


Service

Additional Annual Visits

Own Brand Food

5.0

Accessories

4.2

Vet

2.7

Grooming

4.4

_items.body:
Why is it important that we encourage customers to visit us more frequently? 


The simple answer is that it takes a little bit of extra thought in your conversation, working out the most effective way to encourage our customers back to us. In the spirit of Customer Magic, we want to have a bit of fun as we learn about Great-byes and the opportunities we have. 


Below is an activity that will help you uncover excellent examples of how to encourage our customers back into Pet Care Centre's.

title: Accessibility Pop Up
body:
This course has been created to work to WCAG 2.1 standards. This means that screen readers or other accessibility technologies will work in conjunction to help you complete this course. 


Any audio in this course will come with a Transcript, and any videos, will have a 'CC' icon, visible when you hover over them, which can be clicked to activate the closed captions

title: Course Navigation and Completion
body:
Work your way through this course, taking care to read and interact with everything. Above certain elements you will see labels with a    icon. This shows that the section of the course below needs to be completed. Once complete it will change to   


Once you have completed all necessary sections, it will unlock a final scenario which needs to be completed to finish this course.

title: Accessibility Theme Button
buttonText: Make the course appearance more accessible - Note this is irreversible

title: Accessibility Scroll Down
body: Scroll down

title: Check to complete
body:
I commit to making every effort to include a Great-bye style closing to every customer interaction I have, and understand the role this plays in driving customer visit frequency and sales.


Please tick the box to confirm.
